</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; WIDTH: AUTO">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF">
	Loan from the BIRD
</FONT>
	foundation
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEHEADER">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-LEFT: 78PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF">
	During the second quarter of 2016, the Company repaid the loan received from the Israel United States Binational Industrial Research and Development Foundation (the "BIRD foundation") upon the completion of a certain clinical development. The loan, received in instalments
</FONT>
	between
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF">
	2008 and 2011, was denominated in US dollars and linked to the US Consumer Price Index.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<TABLE ID="ZC64696A525D74F60B073BA0E69B411C0" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: 100%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 49.6PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; WIDTH: 28.35PT; ALIGN: RIGHT">
	b.
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; WIDTH: AUTO">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	Convertible loans:
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<TABLE ID="Z903CE544DCFE4C5BB1615DD21967B169" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: 100%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 81PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; WIDTH: 18PT; ALIGN: RIGHT">
	1)
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; WIDTH: AUTO">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF">
	During the years 2011- 2013 the Company entered into two convertible loan agreements (&#8220;2011 loan agreement&#8221; and &#8220;2012 loan agreement&#8221;), with several of its existing shareholders and other lenders, to receive an aggregate amount of $5,096.&#160; The loans bore interest ranging between 6% and 8%.
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<TABLE ID="Z2E6A413819D442E284DB139B5D27A703" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: 100%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 81PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; WIDTH: 18PT; ALIGN: RIGHT">
	2)
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; WIDTH: AUTO">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF">
	During the first quarter of 2014, the Company reached an agreement with certain lenders of the 2011 convertible loans that were due to mature during that period, according to which the maturity date of those loans was deferred by one year and the interest rate was increased to 12% for the duration of the deferral period (the &#8220;amendment&#8221;).
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-LEFT: 99PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
	The Company has concluded that the amendment to the terms of the 2011 convertible loans is not considered to be &#8220;substantially different&#8221; under ASC 470-50, as the difference between the present value of the original loan and the present value of the modified loan was approximately 3.7%. Accordingly, the amendment was accounted for prospectively as yield adjustment, based on the revised terms of the loans.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
</DIV>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEBREAKAREA" STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10PT; CLEAR: BOTH; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGENUMBERAREA" STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
<FONT ID="DSPFPAGENUMBER" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL; FONT-STYLE: NORMAL">
	F - 21
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEBREAK" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS">
<HR STYLE="BORDER-LEFT-WIDTH: 0PX; HEIGHT: 2PX; BORDER-RIGHT-WIDTH: 0PX; BORDER-BOTTOM-WIDTH: 0PX; COLOR: #000000; CLEAR: BOTH; MARGIN: 4PX 0PX; BORDER-TOP-WIDTH: 0PX; WIDTH: 100%; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #000000" NOSHADE="NOSHADE">
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage111"></A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
	FOAMIX PHARMACEUTICALS LTD.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
	NOTES TO THE CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	&#160;
</FONT>
	(continued)
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
	(U.S. dollars in thousands, except share and per share amounts)
</DIV>
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	NOTE 8 - LOANS
</FONT>
	(continued)
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	:
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<TABLE ID="ZB5B3D2D7B9CA4B88AF8119216CC9917E" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: 100%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 81PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; WIDTH: 18PT; ALIGN: RIGHT">
	3)
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; WIDTH: AUTO">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF">
	Accounting treatment of the loans
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-LEFT: 98.85PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	2011 Convertible Loans:
</FONT>
	The automatic conversion feature in the loans has been bifurcated and accounted for as an embedded derivative, measured initially and subsequently at fair value with changes in fair value recorded as finance expenses. The bifurcated embedded derivative was presented in the Company's balance sheet on a combined basis with the related host contract. The loans were measured at amortized costs using the effective interest rate method.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-LEFT: 98.85PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	2012 Convertible Loans:
</FONT>
	The automatic conversion feature in the loans was bifurcated and accounted for as an embedded derivative measured initially and subsequently at fair value with changes in fair value recorded as finance expenses. The bifurcated embedded derivative is presented in the Company's balance sheet on a combined basis with the related host contract.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-LEFT: 101.15PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
	The Company allocated the proceeds from its issuance of a unit consisting of 2012 convertible loans along with ordinary shares between the convertible loans and the ordinary shares based on their relative fair values at the issuance date of the unit. Then, the Company recorded the embedded derivative feature based on its fair value at the issuance date, and the remaining amount (i.e., the proceeds allocated to the convertible loans less the fair value of the embedded derivative feature) was attributed to the convertible loans.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-LEFT: 101.15PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
	In accordance with ASC 470-20, &#8220;Debt with Conversion and Other Options,&#8221; the Company determined that a BCF existed at the issuance date of the 2012 convertible loans. The BCF was recorded in equity and the loans net of the amount of BCF assigned to them are measured at amortized costs using the effective interest rate method.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-LEFT: 101.15PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
	Accordingly, the Company allocated the proceeds from the 2012 loans between these components as follows:
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<DIV>
<TABLE ID="ZB031ACB57569464AB1D9686E1CC6419A" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: 100%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 101.4PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; WIDTH: 22.4PT; ALIGN: RIGHT">
	(i)
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; WIDTH: AUTO">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF">
	of the $1,448 of 2012 loans received in 2012, $111 were attributed to the embedded derivative, $839 were attributed to the convertible loans and $498 were attributed to the shares.
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF">
	In addition, an amount of $
</FONT>
	668
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF">
	was recognized as a BCF against the 2012 convertible loans, resulting in a presentation of these loans
</FONT>
	(including the embedded derivative)
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF">
	at a net value of $282 at issuance date
</FONT>
	. The Company used Level 3 assumptions in arriving at fair value in order to appropriately allocate the proceeds: fair value of the issued shares was $1,214 and fair value of the convertible loans $2,319.
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<TABLE ID="Z8639A8413D58419AA5E614E62FCD9286" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: 100%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 101.4PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; WIDTH: 22.4PT; ALIGN: RIGHT">
	(ii)
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; WIDTH: AUTO">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF">
	of the to $1,500 of 2012 loans received in 2013, $215 were attributed to the embedded derivative, $689 were attributed to the loans and $596 were attributed to the shares. In addition, an amount of $689 was recognized as a BCF against the 2012 convertible loans, resulting in a presentation of these loans (including the embedded derivative) at a net value of $ 215 at issuance date. The Company used Level 3 assumptions in arriving at fair value in order to appropriately allocate the proceeds: fair value of the issued shares was $1,752 and fair value of the convertible loans $2,662.
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<TABLE ID="Z41142F8E9F8740EE98B2D1CC9CE70D12" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: 100%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 81PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; WIDTH: 18PT; ALIGN: RIGHT">
	4)
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; WIDTH: AUTO">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF">
	The 2014 financing round (see Note 9b) was a qualified round for purposes of the 2011 and 2012 convertible loan agreements. Accordingly, all principal and accrued interest outstanding under such loan agreements were converted into a total of 1,010,350 Preferred A Shares and 505,175 warrants to purchase preferred A shares. Refer to note 9d regarding the conversion of the Preferred A Shares and warrants into Ordinary Shares and warrants.
</DIV>

<A NAME="eolPage112"></A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
	FOAMIX PHARMACEUTICALS LTD.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
	NOTES TO THE CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	&#160;
</FONT>
	(continued)
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
	(U.S. dollars in thousands, except share and per share amounts)
</DIV>
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	NOTE 8 - LOANS
</FONT>
	(continued)
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	:
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-LEFT: 99PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN-RIGHT: 1.95PT">
	In accordance with the amended convertible loan agreements, the lenders were entitled to receive, upon conversion, a total of 1,010,350 warrants to purchase preferred A shares (hereinafter &#8220;the warrants&#8221;). However, the lenders, who were also shareholders of the Company, agreed to receive only half of the warrants that they were entitled to receive in accordance with the loan agreements. The value of the waiver of 505,175 warrants, amounting to $686, was recorded as a capital contribution.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-LEFT: 99PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN-RIGHT: 1.95PT">
	Upon the automatic conversion of the convertible loans, the difference at conversion date between their carrying amount (taking into account the balance of the remaining beneficial conversion feature (BCF) the discount from the allocation of proceeds to the Ordinary Shares and the embedded derivatives) and their fixed monetary amount used for conversion in the amount of $3,520, has been recorded in the statements of operations as finance expenses.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<TABLE ID="ZA09C36DFDEA14362A789C5520EE8430F" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: 100%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 49.6PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; WIDTH: 28.35PT; ALIGN: RIGHT">
	c.
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; WIDTH: AUTO">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	Bank Borrowings
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-LEFT: 78PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF">
	During 2014 the Company entered into several finance agreements with a bank in order to finance
</FONT>
	the
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF">
	purchase of vehicles (hereinafter &#8220;the loans&#8221;). The loans are denominated in NIS and bear interest at a rate per annum equal to
</FONT>
	&#160;
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF">
	Prime
</FONT>
	&#160;
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF">
	minus
</FONT>
	&#160;
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF">
	0.5%. The loans are repayable in 36 monthly payments. The total amounts received as part of the agreement were $102.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-LEFT: 78PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
	In order to secure the loans the bank recorded a lien on the Company&#8217;s vehicles.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
	&#160;
</DIV>

</DIV>

</TD>

</TD>

</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; WIDTH: AUTO">

<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-LEFT: 78PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
	During the second quarter of 2014, the Company completed a private placement (the "2014 financing round") with a group of new investors and several of its existing shareholders, raising a total of $8,157, net of $123 issuance costs, in consideration of 1,036,431 Preferred A Shares par value 0.16 NIS and 1,061,469 warrants to purchase Preferred A Shares (see also d. below). The 2014 financing round closed in two phases, the first on May 13, 2014, and the second on June 3, 2014 (respectively &#8211; "closing date"), raising a gross amount of $6,580 and $1,700, respectively.
</DIV>

<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-LEFT: 78PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
	In September 2014, the Company completed an IPO, pursuant to which the Company issued 7,668,200 ordinary shares (including underwriters &#8216;green shoe&#8217;), NIS 0.16 par value (&#8220;Ordinary Shares&#8221;) at $6.00 per share raising a total of approximately $41,100, net of underwriting discounts, commissions and other offering expenses. Upon the completion of the Company&#8217;s IPO, all outstanding series A preferred shares were automatically converted into Ordinary Shares.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-LEFT: 78PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
	On April 20, 2015, the Company completed a follow-on public offering. A total of 7,419,353 ordinary shares were sold at a price of $9.30 per share. Prior to closing, the underwriters fully exercised their option to purchase 967,741 additional ordinary shares. The net proceeds from the sale of shares, after deducting underwriting discounts, commissions and other offering expenses, were approximately $64,202.

<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-LEFT: 78PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF">
	On September 30, 2016, the Company completed an additional offering in which 5,700,000 ordinary shares were sold at a price of $9.50 per share. On October 28, 2016, the underwriters partially exercised their &#8216;green shoe&#8217; option and purchased
</FONT>
	411,959
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF">
	additional
</FONT>
	ordinary
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF">
	shares.

<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<TABLE ID="Z3224A2691E4B4BDC93582B76091C0CAD" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: 100%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 49.6PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; WIDTH: 28.35PT; ALIGN: RIGHT">
	d.
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; WIDTH: AUTO">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	Preferred A shares and warrants conversion
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-LEFT: 78PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
	In accordance with the Company&#8217;s Articles of association (the &#8220;Articles&#8220;) the initial conversion ratio of each Preferred A Share was set out to be 1:1. As the conversion rate of the Preferred A Shares was greater than 70% of the price per share of the shares issued at the closing of the IPO, the price protection provisions, as defined in the Articles, was triggered and caused the following: (a) the automatic reduction of the conversion price of the Preferred A Shares to a conversion price of 70% of the price paid for the newly issued shares; (b) the increase of the outstanding warrants granted to the 2014 financing round investors and lenders to a total of 2,716,956 warrants and the reduction of the warrants&#8217; exercise price to 70% of the price paid for the newly issued shares which amounted to an exercise price of $5.04 per warrant.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-LEFT: 78PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
	Per the above, upon the completion of the IPO, the total amount of 2,046,781 Preferred A Shares were converted into 3,367,244 Ordinary Shares.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-LEFT: 63.8PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<TABLE ID="ZEDE87E334D8547F5B820CEFBCA749787" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: 100%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 49.6PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; WIDTH: 28.35PT; ALIGN: RIGHT">
	e.
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; WIDTH: AUTO">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	Warrants
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-LEFT: 78PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
	Pursuant to the IPO, the warrants to purchase Preferred A Shares were automatically converted into warrants to purchase Ordinary Shares. Each warrant can be exercised for one ordinary share at an exercise price of $5.04 per share or through a cashless exercise.&#160; The warrants are exercisable until the fourth anniversary of the closing date of the 2014 financing round (May or June 2018).
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-LEFT: 78PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
	During the year ended December 31, 2016, 257,137 warrants were exercised into 257,137 ordinary shares. During the year ended December 31, 2015, 652,019 warrants were exercised into 546,322 ordinary shares. As of December 31, 2016, and December 31, 2015, the total amount of warrants outstanding were 1,807,800 and 2,064,937, respectively.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">

<A NAME="eolPage114"></A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
	FOAMIX PHARMACEUTICALS LTD.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">

	&#160;
</FONT>
	(continued)
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
	(U.S. dollars in thousands, except share and per share amounts)
</DIV>
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	NOTE 9 - SHARE CAPITAL
</FONT>
	(continued):
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<TABLE ID="Z7CDF72B1FA84481DABB6DFF25409703F" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: 100%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 49.6PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; WIDTH: 28.35PT; ALIGN: RIGHT">
	f.
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; WIDTH: AUTO">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	Share-based compensation
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-LEFT: 78PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
	In June 2009, the Company&#8217;s Board of Directors approved a share option plan and reserved a pool of 1,635,694 ordinary shares for grant to Company employees, consultants, directors and other service providers.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-LEFT: 78PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
	In May 2015, the Company's board of directors approved a new option plan (the "Plan") replacing the previous plan approved in 2009. The Plan includes a pool of&#160;2,690,694&#160;ordinary shares for grant to Company employees, consultants, directors and other service providers.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-LEFT: 74.9PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-LEFT: 78PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
	As of December 31, 2016, 845,858 shares remain available for grant under the Plan. As for the increase of the pool, refer to note 13, Subsequent events.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-LEFT: 78PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
	The Plan is designed to enable the Company to grant options to purchase Ordinary Shares and RSUs under various and different tax regimes including, without limitation: (i)&#160;pursuant and subject to Section&#160;102 of the Tax Ordinance or any provision which may amend or replace it and any regulations, rules, orders or procedures promulgated thereunder and to designate them as either grants made through a trustee or not through a trustee; and (ii)&#160;pursuant and subject to Section&#160;3(i) of the Tax Ordinance.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-LEFT: 78PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF">
	The fair value of each option granted is estimated using the Black-Scholes option pricing method. The volatility is based on a combination of the Company&#8217;s historical volatility, historical volatilities of companies in comparable stages as well as companies in the industry, by statistical analysis of daily share pricing model. The risk-free interest rate assumption is based on observed interest rates appropriate for the expected term of the options granted in dollar terms. The Company&#8217;s management uses the contractual term or its expectations, as applicable, of each option as its expected life. The expected term of the options granted is derived from the output of the option pricing model and represents the period of time that granted options are expected to remain outstanding.
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF">
<BR>
</FONT>
</FONT>
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
</DIV>

<DIV ID="DSPFPAGENUMBERAREA" STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
<FONT ID="DSPFPAGENUMBER" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL; FONT-STYLE: NORMAL">

<DIV STYLE="CLEAR: BOTH; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
	NOTE 10 - INCOME TAX:
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-LEFT: 47PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
	The Company is taxed under Israel and the United States of America tax laws:
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<TABLE ID="Z4176D24AB4954158B2F3B3968F0B0263" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: 100%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 49.6PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; WIDTH: 28.35PT; ALIGN: RIGHT">
	a.
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; WIDTH: AUTO">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	Tax rates:
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<TABLE ID="Z481C9D0B363D41EC94AE907A460B7DBD" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: 100%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 79.9PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; WIDTH: 29.4PT; ALIGN: RIGHT">
	1)
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; WIDTH: AUTO">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF">
	Income from Israel was taxed at the corporate tax rate of 26.5% in 2014, 26.5% in 2015, and 25% in 2016. Capital gains are subject to capital gain tax, which equals to 25%.
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-LEFT: 109.3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
	In January 2016, the Law for the Amendment of the Income Tax Ordinance (No. 216) was published, enacting a reduction of corporate tax rate in 2016 and thereafter, from 26.5% to 25%.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-LEFT: 109.3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF">
<BR>
</FONT>
	In December 2016, the Economic Efficiency Law (Legislative Amendments for Implementing the Economic Policy for the 2017 and 2018 Budget Year), 2016 was published, introducing a gradual reduction in corporate tax rate from 25% to 23%. However, the law also included a temporary provision setting the corporate tax rate in 2017 at 24%. As a result, the corporate tax rate will be 24% in 2017 and 23% in 2018 and thereafter.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<TABLE ID="ZAA6A0D3815144E18A6BAC2E22A29DFFB" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: 100%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 79.9PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; WIDTH: 29.4PT; ALIGN: RIGHT">
	2)
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; WIDTH: AUTO">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF">
	Income of the subsidiary is taxed according to the federal tax laws in the US and the relevant state laws. The relevant federal tax rates for 2016, 2015 and 2014 were 35%, 30% and 15%, respectively. The relevant state tax rate for 2016 and 2015 was 9% whereas the state tax rate for 2014 was 7.5%.
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<TABLE ID="ZEC095B59AB2F437DAA022E46626E2F70" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: 100%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 49.6PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; WIDTH: 28.35PT; ALIGN: RIGHT">
	b.
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; WIDTH: AUTO">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	Tax
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF">
	&#160;
</FONT>
	assessments
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-LEFT: 80PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
	Foamix has tax assessments that are considered to be final through tax year 2012.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<TABLE ID="Z3C9A2882CB864A8FA5A85D42DCDF02A5" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: 100%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 49.6PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; WIDTH: 28.35PT; ALIGN: RIGHT">
	c.
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; WIDTH: AUTO">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	Tax benefits under the Law for Encouragement of Industry (Taxation), 1969
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-LEFT: 78.6PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
	The Company believes that it currently qualifies as an "Industrial Company" under the above law.&#160;As such it is entitled to certain tax benefits, mainly the right to deduct share issuance costs over three years for tax purposes in the event of a public offering.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-LEFT: 78.6PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN-RIGHT: 70.85PT">
	The Company utilizes this tax benefit.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<TABLE ID="ZB9562C67054D4DD6A1C621C5926DBBBC" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: 100%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 49.6PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; WIDTH: 28.35PT; ALIGN: RIGHT">
	d.
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; WIDTH: AUTO">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	Losses for tax purposes carried forward to future years
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-LEFT: 78.6PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
	As of December 31, 2016, Foamix had approximately $50.1 million of net carry forward tax losses in Israel, which are available to reduce future taxable income with no limited period of use.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEBREAKAREA" STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10PT; CLEAR: BOTH; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">

</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<TABLE ID="Z17AB8CBC83844765AA7C9891C99BD829" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: 100%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">

<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<TABLE ID="Z57C7FFA23DCE4D5C84BF013CF52E0183" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: 89%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" ALIGN="RIGHT" BORDER="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; PADDING-BOTTOM: 2PX" VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	&#160;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: BOTTOM; PADDING-BOTTOM: 2PX" VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	&#160;
</TD>

</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<DIV STYLE="CLEAR: BOTH; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-LEFT: 80.7PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
	Realization of deferred tax assets is contingent upon sufficient future taxable income during the period that deductible temporary differences and carry forward losses are expected to be available to reduce taxable income. As the achievement of required future taxable income is not likely, the Company recorded a full valuation allowance.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-LEFT: 80.7PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
	Deferred tax has not been provided on taxes that would apply in the event of disposal of the investments in the subsidiary, as it is the Company&#8217;s intention to hold this investment and not to realize it.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-LEFT: 80.7PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
	Foamix may incur an additional tax liability in the event of an inter-company dividend distribution from its subsidiary; no additional deferred taxes have been provided, since it is the Company&#8217;s policy not to distribute in the foreseeable future, dividends which would result in additional tax liability.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-LEFT: 80.7PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
	Following is a reconciliation of the theoretical tax benefit, assuming all income is taxed at the statutory corporate tax rate applicable to Israeli corporations, and the actual tax expense:
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
	&#160;

<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-LEFT: 78.6PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
	In the year ended December 31, 2016, the Company&#8217;s revenues were driven virtually all from one main customer. Based on the agreement with this customer the Company is entitled to royalty payments with respect to sales of a product developed by the customer in collaboration with the Company. Additionally, the Company was entitled to contingent payments for the achievement of certain sale targets by the customer.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-LEFT: 78.6PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">

<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
	NOTE 13 - SUBSEQUENT EVENTS
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-LEFT: 47.7PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
	In November, 2016, the board of directors approved an increase of 900,000 ordinary shares, to the pool included under the option Plan. The shares were registered in January 2017.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">

<DIV STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">

</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
	I, Dov Tamarkin, certify that:
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<TABLE ID="Z4A45334F01734FE687DCD0C41F51FDBD" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: 100%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">

</TR>
</TABLE>

</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>

	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">

</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>

<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF">

</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>

	a)
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: AUTO; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF">
	Designed such disclosure controls and procedures, or caused such disclosure controls and procedures to be designed under our supervision, to ensure that material information relating to the company, including its consolidated subsidiaries, is made known to us by others within those entities, particularly during the period in which this report is being prepared;
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">

	b)

<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF">
	Designed such internal control over financial reporting, or caused such internal control over financial reporting to be designed under our supervision, to provide reasonable assurance regarding the reliability of financial reporting and the preparation of financial statements for external purposes in accordance with generally accepted accounting principles;
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>

</DIV>

<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 96.55%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	(2)&#160;The information contained in the Report fairly presents, in all material respects, the financial condition and results of operations of the Company.
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
